issue.title: Site is broken because of filter in AdGuard

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

I use another blocker, uBlock Origin 1.46.1b8

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

snowplow.io

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Self-destruction of third-party cookies

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. The text on the main page is supposed to be moving, but it's not because of the filter /snowplow.*.js in AdGuard Tracking Protection. I suggest making this a third party only filter, or add @@/snowplow.*.js$domain=snowplow.io.
(There is supposed to be an asterisk between both of the dots in the filters shown above, but GitHub doesn't seem to allow me to do that without making the text different)
### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
> I disabled all other Safari extensions (w/ AdGuard for Safari still enabled) and the Like button still won't load

That's strange, but I meant filters in the AdGuard for Safari, not the extensions.
1. Turn on all the web extensions in Safari settings
2. Leave only AdGuard Social Media filter in the AdGuard for Safari
3. Other filters should be disabled
4. Update the filter, then wait nearly one minute
5. Open safari and then the site.

I don't see the rules that block the like button.

```
maniac.de#$#body { overflow: auto !important; cursor: auto !important; }
```

comment.body:
So https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/139653 is not working? If not, there's no point in having the rule.
@Alex-302 Most of Japanese mobile user are iOS, and most of them enable DNS filtering. IMO we shouldn't ignore these facts, unless it's really impossible to fix.

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://trello.com/b/UxSwOSpw/rezepte](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftrello.com%2Fb%2FUxSwOSpw%2Frezepte) ### Comment Username: @Scolaro > Screenshot 1 (AdGuard on): I press "Attachment", choose the image I want to upload to the card and get the error message in the lower left corner. > Screenshot 2 (AdGuard off): I press "Attachment", choose the image I want to upload to the card and get the success message. The image appears in the card. > > Every once in a while an image goes through when AdGuard is on (because I forget to turn it off), but it's mostly the first one, then nothing else goes through until I turn AdGuard off. > Oftentimes I also get an error (from Trello on their website) that I am not connected to the server. Everything (creating cards, changing text etc) continues to work except for the image upload, and once AdGuard is off there are no more server error messages on the Trello site either. > Note that all my Trello pages are affected by this issue, not just the "Rezepte" one from the screenshots. ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://trello.com/b/UxSwOSpw/rezepte](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftrello.com%2Fb%2FUxSwOSpw%2Frezepte) ### Comment Username: @Scolaro > Screenshot 1 (AdGuard on): I press "Attachment", choose the image I want to upload to the card and get the error message in the lower left corner. > Screenshot 2 (AdGuard off): I press "Attachment", choose the image I want to upload to the card and get the success message. The image appears in the card. > > Every once in a while an image goes through when AdGuard is on (because I forget to turn it off), but it's mostly the first one, then nothing else goes through until I turn AdGuard off. > Oftentimes I also get an error (from Trello on their website) that I am not connected to the server. Everything (creating cards, changing text etc) continues to work except for the image upload, and once AdGuard is off there are no more server error messages on the Trello site either. > Note that all my Trello pages are affected by this issue, not just the "Rezepte" one from the screenshots. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Hi Alex-302, 
thank you for commenting!
Apparently no filter is the cause of this. I turned them all off and the issue still persists.
![Screenshot 2023-01-12 155529](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14360631/212100182-c6a941ce-7f9d-48fd-9058-6c40253b9e08.jpg)

The only way to make this work is to exit AdGuard completely.
